238fa50a-0f78-4d64-abbb-2a6ad021cbbe.description: The course objective is to discover and practice financial math concepts that apply to everyday life; calculate taxes, create a budget, identify types of taxes, and how to fill out a tax form; cover financial institutions, interest rates, credit, debt, and credit cards; explore different types of insurance and loans; plan for retirement and looking ahead as part of their financial plans.
238fa50a-0f78-4d64-abbb-2a6ad021cbbe.name: Financial Math

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies; written papers, performance rubrics, examination, and presentations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

907d28f2-746b-42c6-bcb2-3690dcc525eb.description: The course provides knowledge of all essential parts of the academic writing process including mechanics and structure, information literacy, MLA style and citation, developing strong paragraphs, research basics, and the steps of the writing process. Students apply skills by writing essays including narratives, examples and illustration, comparison or contrast, cause and effect, and definitions; and participate in key components of the revision process, including self-analysis and peer review.
907d28f2-746b-42c6-bcb2-3690dcc525eb.name: English Composition I

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, written paper, performance rubrics, presentations, and teacher facilitated discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

dfce6434-b460-4a59-a0f7-05c1e25bff3b.description: The course builds upon foundations established in pre-algebra and basic mathematics to develop an understanding of how to perform operations and solve problems with real numbers. Students focus on linear relations by developing fluency with the language and operations of algebra to analyze and represent relationships while performing exercises to demonstrate understanding. Students learn to graph and solve for a variety of functions, including linear, quadratic, and exponential.
dfce6434-b460-4a59-a0f7-05c1e25bff3b.name: Intermediate Algebra

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubric, and teacher facilitated discussions with a minimum pasing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, and learner presentation.

023f6126-4749-47b3-8a42-224204c48aec.description: The course objective is to discover and develop the necessary skills to engage in life and career planning; focus on self-assessment, occupational exploration, and decision-making; discuss the conditions that impact career development and create a strategic career plan.
023f6126-4749-47b3-8a42-224204c48aec.name: Career Development

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

178af598-38e5-4bfc-b936-0cef4bda21a9.description: Students learn and apply the rules for constructing and defining medical terms with an emphasis on building a working medical vocabulary; topics include appropriate abbreviations and symbols for anatomical, physiological and pathological classifications and the associated medical specialties and procedures; identifying and using word elements with an emphasis on derivation, meaning, and pronunciation; how to interpret and translate medical records and documents.
178af598-38e5-4bfc-b936-0cef4bda21a9.name: Medical Terminology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, laboratory, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

e35cbf57-0818-4139-8876-ef8e3d7f8939.description: The course objective is to provide students a basic introduction to the emotional, physical, and psychological development of young children; to explore several developmental models and theories, along with biological, chemical, and behavioral changes children go through as they grow; to explore parenting and caregiver resources, along with roles of various family members and support systems.
e35cbf57-0818-4139-8876-ef8e3d7f8939.name: Child Development for Caretakers

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

9eb88f8c-45d5-402f-8b3d-4feea5c4a000.description: The course objective is to examine a variety of functions including quadratic, absolute value, piecewise, step, rational, radical, polynomial, and exponential. For all functions, students will be shown how to solve for key values, graph each type, and work within the necessary domain. The course also introduces students to a variety of statistics and probability topics, including sequences, series, finding probabilities, normal distributions, surveys, and experiments.
9eb88f8c-45d5-402f-8b3d-4feea5c4a000.name: College Algebra II

The methods of instruction include discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, and learner presentations.

845cd9b6-7240-4f70-97b7-3ac3579dad55.description: The course objective is to introduce students to computing fundamentals; how a computer works, digital communication skills, social networking, and internet issues; how to practice essential digital skills including word processing, spreadsheets, databases, and creating presentations.
845cd9b6-7240-4f70-97b7-3ac3579dad55.name: Digital Literacy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, and presentations with a minimum passing score is 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

34ba7127-d058-4b74-8641-fb2556e4738d.description: The course objective is to teach students to examine the goals of education and training as well as environments in which education and training are delivered; identify learners' and stakeholders' roles, rights and responsibilities in educational systems; assess legal and ethical issues related to education; determine careers of interest in education and training; understand employability skills and state requirements for becoming an educator.
34ba7127-d058-4b74-8641-fb2556e4738d.name: Foundations of Education and Training

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, and presentations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

f69acc05-650f-49bc-a3b5-289fa1faee14.description: The course objective is to provide students with knowledge of current industry standard, commercial, and open source programming software to create 3-D visual elements in a web or standalone environment; knowledge of aspects of computer visual production, thought, and application; how to map out, design, and test three-dimensional elements.
f69acc05-650f-49bc-a3b5-289fa1faee14.name: Introduction to Digital and Interactive Media

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, and learner presentations.

ecad02f8-92d5-46f3-9244-cedc201df23b.description: The course explores how psychology informs human thought, emotion, and behavior. Students examine the history of psychology, research and applied psychology, biopsychology, human development, sensation and perception, thinking and cognition, language acquisition, mechanisms of memory and cognition, intelligence, motivation and emotion, personality, psychological disorder and treatment, and social psychology, explained and evaluated from a biological-psychological-social perspective.
ecad02f8-92d5-46f3-9244-cedc201df23b.name: Introduction to Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, and presentations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, and learner presentations.

6deebd69-cb93-4c5f-9f4b-76d3f04bdf14.description: The course objective is to teach students to examine and apply the theoretical foundations of human growth and development to children and adolescents; determine children's learning styles, stages of social, emotional, cognitive and physical development, and needed accommodations in educational settings; understand family and community engagement, cultural influences on learners and language growth and development.
6deebd69-cb93-4c5f-9f4b-76d3f04bdf14.name: Child Development Psychology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

9737a66b-6c65-490b-9295-207308581343.description: The course objective is to teach students to write at the college level using library research and source-evaluation strategies. Considerations such as audience analysis, source analysis and evaluation, and theme are addressed. Students will focus on developing, drafting, and completing a research topic. They will apply skills such as brainstorming, drafting, and editing to create a research-based essay tailored to the needs of the reader.
9737a66b-6c65-490b-9295-207308581343.name: English Composition II

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance based rubrics, presentations, and teacher faciliated discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

7fd078cb-08c7-4f49-b5c2-e74e76923d2b.description: The course objective is to examine all aspects of business law including the judicial system, differences between types of law and origins of law, administrative and employment laws and laws impacting individuals as well as businesses. Students will research real estate and debtor and creditor laws and regulations, and will learn to support attorneys by conducting legal research and preparing fully-compliant legal documents. Compliance and contract law will be emphasized.
7fd078cb-08c7-4f49-b5c2-e74e76923d2b.name: Legal Environment of Business

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

7b91b338-311e-4bc8-8271-49f1ccffe2b2.description: The course objective is to obtain knowledge and skills in fundamental business activities. Students with acquire knowledge of business processes, economics and business relationships, and will use technology to synthesize and share business information. Employability skills, leadership and communications, and personal financial literacy will be addressed.
7b91b338-311e-4bc8-8271-49f1ccffe2b2.name: Business Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

a8600c3f-ae2a-4d8d-b4df-5260937d7142.description: The course objective is to teach students to examine the history and philosophy of early childhood education, types of early childhood programs, and the roles, rights and responsibilities of learners and stakeholders in early childhood education; assess developmental appropriate practices, legal, ethical and organizational issues, and the challenge of teaching and caring for young children with diverse needs; understand career planning and professionalism.
a8600c3f-ae2a-4d8d-b4df-5260937d7142.name: Early Childhood Education Principles

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, and presentations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

c8c6a46a-e22c-4b60-801a-1144b1a96311.description: The course objective is to provide students knowledge on techniques to secure and protect America's people and infrastructure from natural and manmade disaster; a range of issues including cyber security, intelligence gathering, and local emergency planning that can be applied in their own community; how to manage critical incidents thought training in National Incident Management and the Incident Command System.
c8c6a46a-e22c-4b60-801a-1144b1a96311.name: Homeland Security

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with the minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

e37dae24-3d46-4e97-be3f-aa3eaa778925.description: The course objective is to provide students with the knowledge of anatomical structures and physiology of the human body; body systems in terms of how each participates in homeostasis of the body; selected major pathologies, including causes, symptoms, diagnostic procedures, and treatments, as well as common changes that occur through the lifespan; medical terminology, various biology tests, and laboratory procedures.
e37dae24-3d46-4e97-be3f-aa3eaa778925.name: Human Anatomy & Physiology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

1f79bd57-0737-4d62-baf1-eaccda6b04bc.description: The course objective is to provide students with a working knowledge of computer concepts and essential skills necessary for work and communication in today's society. Students will learn safety, security, and ethical issues in computing and social networking as well as about input/output systems, computer hardware and operating systems, and office applications.
1f79bd57-0737-4d62-baf1-eaccda6b04bc.name: Information Technology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, laboratory, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, classroom exercise.

68ca50a0-1a19-4921-9056-69a1bb6f8ddf.description: The course explores the scientific method and foundational chemistry facts that assist students in the further study of Biology. Topics include cell structure and cellular processes, DNA, photosynthesis, cellular activities,ecosystems, biodiversity, matter and energy, the carbon cycle, organ systems and human impacts on the different ecosystems. Throughout the course, students will be asked to demonstrate critical thinking, literacy, and writing skills through scientific inquiry.
68ca50a0-1a19-4921-9056-69a1bb6f8ddf.name: Introduction to Biology

The methods of instruction include audio visual, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, and learner presentations.

ed06b2c0-3f87-4061-9f12-1b4b77cab3cb.description: The course objective is to obtain fundamental knowledge and skills in accounting, banking services, corporate finance, insurance, and securities and investments; acquire knowledge of financial analysis and application, business law and ethics, economics, international business and business relationships; gain knowledge on management, information technology, employability skills, leadership, and communications.
ed06b2c0-3f87-4061-9f12-1b4b77cab3cb.name: Introduction to Business

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

45c79c61-3224-4966-810a-5a7a1d1af5b7.description: The course objective is to teach students to install, repair, and troubleshoot computer hardware systems; perform preventative maintenance practices; learn techniques for maintaining computer hardware security; communication skills and professionalism in troubleshooting situations will be emphasized.
45c79c61-3224-4966-810a-5a7a1d1af5b7.name: Introduction to Information Communications Technology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

dd919229-8bcd-47a9-b36c-48d25156f5f6.description: The course examines the foundations of sociological theory and challenges students to make connections to current and historical examples. Students analyze issues in society from competing theoretical perspectives and discover how different perspectives allow new insights and possible explanations for beliefs, attitudes, and behaviors. Students embrace creativity, critical thinking skills and diverse ways of thinking to find multiple explanations for our often seemingly inexplicable world.
dd919229-8bcd-47a9-b36c-48d25156f5f6.name: Introduction to Sociology

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, and teacher facilitated discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include case studies, discussion, computer based learning, practical exercises, and learner presentations.

b0fca721-937f-4673-8b6d-0ac1c2b95fcf.description: Students gain basic knowledge and clinical skills necessary to assess, plan, provide, and evaluate care to patients in varied healthcare settings; including first aid principles and techniques needed for response to choking, cardiopulmonary resuscitation, and other life-threatening emergencies, regulatory compliance, patient safety, pathophysiology, and medical interventions. Additionally, this course introduces psychomotor skills needed to assist individuals in meeting basic human needs.
b0fca721-937f-4673-8b6d-0ac1c2b95fcf.name: Principles of Allied Health

The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

58d6d886-e3f7-4730-9623-d6aeb87b02fb.description: The course objective is to provide students with knowledge of programming projects and basic programming concepts. Students will recognize key elements of working on an information technology project so they can be successful in future careers, and then will learn the basics of programming concepts.
58d6d886-e3f7-4730-9623-d6aeb87b02fb.name: Programming Careers

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, written papers, performance rubrics, examination, presentations, and discussions with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual, case studies, discussion, computer based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, and classroom exercise.

e66cded7-6cd2-4517-8c57-e317bf3b0d20.description: The course teaches basic concepts of probability and statistics, beginning with probability and various distributions working with random variables and events. The course continues with descriptive and inference statistical studies that describe methods of collecting, summarizing, interpreting and concluding information from the data displayed in various mediums. Lastly, the students will recognize various characteristics of data and a number of ways that the data is related.
e66cded7-6cd2-4517-8c57-e317bf3b0d20.name: Statistics

The methods of instruction include discussion, computer based learning, practical exercises, and learner presentations.

300fe1df-2de8-462a-817d-978815a0ce2c.description: The course objective is to teach students the dynamics of the Web environment while pursuing an in-depth study of both Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS); web based protocols such as FTP, TCP/IP, and HTTP; how to create a website with tag text elements, special characters, lines, graphics, hypertext links, and graphical tables.
300fe1df-2de8-462a-817d-978815a0ce2c.name: Web Design
